title: 114_hr3571
content: The "Fuel Cell Tax Extenders Act of 2015" extends and modifies fuel cell credits. The Fuel Cell Tax Extenders Act of 2015 extends the Residential Energy Efficient Property Credit for qualified fuel cell property until December 31, 2021. It also extends the Energy Credit for construction commenced by December 31, 2021. The amendments made by this subsection apply to property where construction began after the enactment of the Act on December 31, 2021. SEC. 3. Extension and modification of hydrogen-related credits. Extension of Alternative Motor Vehicle Credit to December 31, 2021 and Extension and Modification of Alternative Fuel Vehicle Refueling Property Credit with different effective dates. Extension of Alternative Motor Vehicle Credit to December 31, 2021 and Modification of Alternative Fuel Vehicle Refueling Property Credit to increase the limitation for hydrogen-related properties to $200,000. The text chunk discusses amending the tax code to include off-highway vehicles in the Alternative Motor Vehicle Credit for hydrogen fuel properties. The text chunk defines vehicles as motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding certain equipment and vehicles operating exclusively on rails. The text chunk extends and modifies the alternative fuel credit for hydrogen, expanding the credit to all hydrogen and extending the deadline to December 31, 2021. The amendments apply to property sold or used after December 31, 2014.
